content.title: Scalenectomy and First Rib Resection
content.summary: Scalenectomy and first rib resection are the primary surgical treatments for thoracic outlet syndrome. The procedures decompress the thoracic outlet by removing compressive structures and creating space for the neurovascular bundle.
content.definition: Surgical removal of the anterior scalene muscle and/or first rib to decompress the thoracic outlet and relieve compression of the brachial plexus, subclavian artery, or subclavian vein

criteria: True neurogenic TOS with EMG abnormalities

transaxillary.description: First rib resection through axillary incision
transaxillary.technique: Arm elevated, lateral decubitus, rib resection from costochondral junction to transverse process

supraclavicular.description: Scalenectomy ± partial first rib through supraclavicular incision
